document.heading: Fiscal Year 2020 Revised Local Budget Adjustment Emergency Act of 2020
To adjust, on an emergency basis, certain allocations in the Fiscal Year 2020 Local Budget Act of 2019 to maintain a balanced budget for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2020.
document.text: BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Fiscal Year 2020 Revised Local Budget Adjustment Emergency Act of 2020".

section.text: The appropriations set forth in the Fiscal Year 2020 Local Budget Act of 2019, effective August 31, 2019 (D.C. Law 23-11; 66 DCR 8242), are decreased by ($350,919,995) (including ($317,868,607) in local funds, ($23,355,258) in dedicated taxes, $9,000,000 in enterprise funds, and ($18,696,130) in other funds), to be allocated as follows:

para.text: The appropriation for Governmental Direction and Support is decreased by ($9,712,253) in local funds, to be allocated as follows:
Board of Ethics and Government Accountability. – ($71,000) is rescinded from local funds;
Captive Insurance Agency. – ($107,966) is rescinded from local funds;
Contract Appeals Board. – ($61,621) is rescinded from local funds;
Department of General Services. –$9,654,210 is added to local funds;
Department of Human Resources. – $200,000 is added to local funds;
Executive Office of the Mayor. – ($700,000) is rescinded from local funds;
Mayor's Office of Legal Counsel. – ($425,000) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of Campaign Finance. – ($483,149) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of Contracting and Procurement. – ($2,365,951) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of Disability Rights. – ($51,784) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of Employee Appeals. – ($35,343) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of Finance and Resource Management. – ($383,000) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of Risk Management. – ($368,898) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of the Attorney General for the District of Columbia. – ($1,519,348) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of the Chief Financial Officer. – ($2,000,000) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of the Chief Technology Officer. – ($8,166,742) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of the City Administrator. – ($350,000) is rescinded from local funds;

Office of the Senior Advisor. – ($86,769) is rescinded from local funds;
Public Employee Relations Board. – ($127,526) is rescinded from local funds; and
Expenditure Commission. – ($924,366) is rescinded from local funds.
The appropriation for Economic Development and Regulation is decreased by ($17,805,648) in local funds, to be allocated as follows:
Commission on the Arts and Humanities. – ($983,010) is rescinded from local funds;
Department of Consumer and Regulatory Affairs. – ($350,000) is rescinded from local funds;
Department of Employment Services. – ($2,900,783) is rescinded from local funds;
Department of Housing and Community Development. – ($321,710) is rescinded from local funds;
Department of Small and Local Business Development. – ($535,035) is rescinded from local funds;
Housing Authority Subsidy. – ($15,871,000) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of Cable Television, Film, Music, and Entertainment. – ($186,698) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of Planning. – ($368,038) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of the Deputy Mayor for Planning and Economic Development. – $4,380,000 is added to local funds;
Office of the People's Counsel. – ($74,226) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of the Tenant Advocate. – ($311,897) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of Zoning. – ($190,261) is rescinded from local funds;
Real Property Tax Appeals Commission. – ($28,290) is rescinded from local funds; and
Rental Housing Commission – ($64,700) is rescinded from local funds.
The appropriation for Public Safety and Justice is decreased by ($202,333,690) in local funds, to be allocated as follows:
Corrections Information Council. – ($7,817) is rescinded from local funds;
Criminal Code Reform Commission. – ($68,779) is rescinded from local funds;
Criminal Justice Coordinating Council. – ($231,285) is rescinded from local funds;
Department of Corrections. – ($22,658,465) is rescinded from local funds;
Department of Forensic Sciences. – ($1,119,022) is rescinded from local funds;
District of Columbia National Guard. – ($112,481) is rescinded from local funds;
District of Columbia Sentencing Commission. – ($120,204) is rescinded from local funds;
Fire and Emergency Medical Services Department. – ($72,750,000) is rescinded from local funds;
Metropolitan Police Department. – ($97,519,285) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of Administrative Hearings. – $74,350 is added to local funds;
Office of Neighborhood Safety and Engagement. – ($454,788) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of Police Complaints. – ($160,000) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of the Chief Medical Examiner. – ($2,392,373) is rescinded from local funds;

The appropriation for Public Education System is decreased by ($18,792,741) in local funds, to be allocated as follows:
District of Columbia Public Charter Schools. – $5,655,390 is added to local funds;
District of Columbia Public Library. – ($1,411,494) is rescinded from local funds;
District of Columbia Public Schools. – ($5,841,830) is rescinded from local funds;

The appropriation for Human Support Services is decreased by ($91,696,481) in local funds, to be allocated as follows:
Child and Family Services Agency. – ($2,999,274) is rescinded from local funds;

Department of Human Services. – $12,084,296 is added to local funds;
Department of Parks and Recreation. – ($3,415,809) is rescinded from local funds;
Department of Youth Rehabilitation Services. – ($7,017,034) is rescinded from local funds;
Department on Disability Services. – ($20,700,000) is rescinded from local funds;
Employees' Compensation Fund. – ($3,789,438) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of Human Rights. – ($728,995) is rescinded from local funds;

Office on Asian and Pacific Islander Affairs. – ($8,125) is rescinded from local funds; and
Office on Latino Affairs. – ($71,650) is rescinded from local funds.
The appropriation for Public Works is decreased by $50,234,867 (including ($8,183,479) in local funds, ($23,355,258) in dedicated taxes, and ($18,696,130) in other funds) to be allocated as follows:
Department of Energy and Environment. – ($3,851,483) is rescinded from local funds;
Department of For-Hire Vehicles. – ($369,569) is rescinded from local funds;
Department of Motor Vehicles. – $2,245,119 is added to local funds;
Department of Public Works. – ($3,943,398) is rescinded from local funds;
Department of Transportation. – ($2,184,399) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of the Deputy Mayor for Operations and Infrastructure. – ($79,749) is rescinded from local funds; and
Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority. – ($42,251,388) is rescinded (including ($23,355,258) from dedicated taxes and ($18,696,130) from other funds).
The appropriation for Financing and Other is increased by $30,655,685 in local funds to be allocated as follows:
Non-Departmental. – $13,753,300 is added to local funds;
Pay-As-You-Go Capital Fund. – ($17,000,000) is rescinded from local funds;
Emergency and Contingency Reserve Funds. – $23,737,344 is added to local funds;
Workforce Investments Account. – $2,037,034 is added to local funds;
Settlements and Judgements. – ($871,993) is rescinded from local funds; and
Convention Center Transfer. – $9,000,000 is added to local funds.
The appropriation for Enterprise and Other is increased by $9,000,000 in enterprise funds to be allocated as follows:
Washington Convention and Sports Authority. – $9,000,000 is added to enterprise funds.

section.codify:annotation: For an emergency (90-day) adjustment, on an emergency basis, of certain allocations in the Fiscal Year 2020 Local Budget Act of 2019 to maintain a balanced budget for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2020, see the Fiscal Year 2020 Revised Local Budget Adjustment Emergency Act of 2020, D.C. Act 23-351, August 5, 2020, 67 DCR 9638.

For an emergency (90-day) adjustment, on an emergency basis, of certain allocations in the Fiscal Year 2020 Local Budget Act of 2019 to maintain a balanced budget for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2020, see the Fiscal Year 2020 Revised Local Budget Adjustment Emergency Act of 2020, D.C. Act 23-351, August 5, 2020, 67 DCR 9638.

section.heading: Advance payments to District of Columbia Public Schools and Public Charter Schools.

para.text: Section 2 of the Fiscal Year 2020 Local Budget Act of 2019, effective August 31, 2019 (D.C. Law 23-11; 66 DCR 8242), is amended as follows:

The appropriation for District of Columbia Public Charter Schools is amended by striking the phrase "(as adopted by the District)" and inserting the phrase "(as approved by the Council on second reading)" in its place.

The appropriation for District of Columbia Public Schools is amended by striking the phrase "(as adopted by the District)" and inserting the phrase "(as approved by the Council on second reading)" in its place.

Notwithstanding section 2403(a)(2)(A)(i) of the District of Columbia School Reform Act of 1995, approved April 26, 1996 (110 Stat. 1321; D.C. Official Code § 38-1804.03(a)(2)(A)(i)), and section 107b of the Uniform Per Student Funding Formula for Public Schools and Public Charter Schools Act of 1998, effective April 13, 2005 (D.C. Law 15-348; D.C. Official Code § 38-2906.02) ("UPSFF Act"), for school year 2020-2021, the Mayor shall make the first quarterly payment required to be made to public charter schools pursuant to section 107b of the UPSFF Act no later than August 1, 2020.
This section shall apply as of July 15, 2020.

Notwithstanding any provision of law limiting the use of funds in the accounts listed in the following chart, the Chief Financial Officer shall transfer in Fiscal Year 2020 the following amounts from certified fund balances and other revenue in the identified accounts to the General Fund of the District of Columbia:

tr.td: Historic Landmark and Historic District Filing Fees
State Athletic Acts Programming and Office Fund
ABC - Import and Class License Fees
DMH Medicare and Third Party Reimbursement

para.text: Notwithstanding any provision of law limiting the use of funds in the accounts listed in D.C. Official Code § 47-392.02(j-5)(1) and (2), the amounts deposited and committed to those accounts pursuant to D.C. Official Code § 47-392.02(j-5) in Fiscal Year 2020, based on the Comprehensive Annual Financial Report for Fiscal Year 2019, shall, after such deposits and commitments have been made, be transferred by the Chief Financial Officer before the end of Fiscal Year 2020 to the unassigned balance of the General Fund of the District of Columbia.
The amounts identified in subsections (a) and (b) of this section shall be made available as set forth in the approved Fiscal Year 2021 Budget and Financial Plan.

section.heading: Capital project reallocations.
section.text: In Fiscal Year 2020, the Chief Financial Officer shall rescind or adjust capital project allotments as set forth in the following tabular array, with the savings to be used as set forth in the approved Fiscal Year 2021 Budget and Financial Plan:

section.heading: Notwithstanding any provision of law, the $3,204,936 to be received by the District from the sale of Parcel 17 on the St.
section.text: Elizabeths campus shall be made available as set forth in this act.

section.heading: Fiscal impact statement.
section.text: The Council adopts the fiscal impact statement of the Chief Financial Officer as the fiscal impact statement required by section 4a of the General Legislative Procedures Act of 1975, approved October 16, 2006 (120 Stat. 2038; D.C. Official Code § 1-301.47a).

section.heading: Effective date.
section.text: This act shall take effect following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council to override the veto), and shall remain in effect for no longer than 90 days, as provided for emergency acts of the Council of the District of Columbia in section 412(a) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 788; D.C. Official Code § 1-204.12(a)).
